docs.snippet: Tuesday’s highlights from around the Web include a report of the reign of Internet Explorer in South Korea because of a 14-year-old law. Plus, the author of a book about Amazon responds to a negative review from the wife of Jeff Bezos, the compa...
docs.abstract: Tuesday’s highlights from around the Web include a report of the reign of Internet Explorer in South Korea because of a 14-year-old law. Plus, the author of a book about Amazon responds to a negative review from the wife of Jeff Bezos, the company’s founder, posted on Amazon.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: A Land Where I.E. Still Dominates, and Responding to Bezos's Wife
